Description: Fragment of round handle from a Brindisi pottery transport amphora. Clay near fine micaceous brick-red; cream surface. Rectangular stamp at top of handle with Latin inscription.
Curator's comments: Names, Tarula and Sulla. cf. Desy, Ph., Les timbres amphoriques de l'Apulie republicaine (Oxford 1989) 170. P. Palazzo, Le anfore di Apani (Brindisi), Rome 2013, 157-8. Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p. 28a, 26.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1302)
